column4: hi.  when a new windows opens on the desktop [a program, folder, etc], it's always stuck in one of the corners.  how can i change that, so it's in the middle of the screen?
if you're using compiz you need only to set the window placement parament to center
thanks for the clue, i'll have a look
/apps/compiz/plugins/place/screen0/options/mode, set it to 2. you need gconf-editor.
thanks, i found the setting, but it doesn't seem to have worked.
i think i am, how can i confirm?
you have compiz running. if you set the key right you should be getting centered windows poping up all over the center.
i believe i have it set right.  it was labelled as you described - 1 = center
is there a shell command i can use to print settings?
install CCSM from the software centre. It will make turning on plugins for compiz a snap. That's the theory anyway.
i must have been doing something wrong before.  adjusting the setting using ccsm seems to have worked.  thanks for the help
